definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
(onom.) for crack, slap, clap, clatter etc
variant of 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
(onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
variant of 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
see 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]

sentences.english: He broke off the twig with a snap.
sentences.chinese: 他啪地一聲把那根樹枝折斷了。

sentences.english: The cork popped out and the champagnegushed from the bottle.
sentences.chinese: 軟木塞啪地一聲蹦了出來，香檳就從瓶口噴出來了。

sentences.english: "Here we go, Dan"he said plopping it on his desk.
sentences.chinese: “丹，給，”他啪的一聲把報告桌子上。

sentences.english: With a malicious crackle the old man held up a small white swaddling garment.
sentences.chinese: 老頭啪一聲狠狠扯下毯子上的一個白色的小裝飾。

sentences.english: She smacked the script on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她把腳本啪的一聲扔到了地板上。

sentences.english: The branch cracked under the weight of the snow.
sentences.chinese: 樹枝在雪的重壓下啪地一聲折斷了。

sentences.english: The door has a snap bolt.
The old man slapped the saddle upon the mare's back.
sentences.chinese: 老人啪的一聲把鞍子放到馬背上。

sentences.english: He smashed the radio to pieces.
sentences.chinese: 他啪的一聲把收音機摔得稀巴爛。

sentences.english: The dry branch snapped in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 在大風中幹樹枝啪地一聲折斷了。

sentences.english: The ice cream plopped to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 冰激凌啪的一聲掉地上了。

sentences.english: Frog mother is speaking, belly actually pa split.
sentences.chinese: 青蛙媽媽正說着話，肚皮卻啪一聲裂開了。

sentences.english: The whip cracked down on the horse's rump.
sentences.chinese: 鞭子啪地一聲抽在馬屁股上。

sentences.english: He stretched the rubber band till it snapped.
sentences.chinese: 他拉長橡皮筋，啪地一聲拉斷了。

sentences.english: A suit of armour fell over with a loud crash.
sentences.chinese: 冑甲啪的一聲重重地摔在了地上。

sentences.english: He sent the horse forward with a slap on its rump .
sentences.chinese: 鞭子啪地一聲抽在馬屁股上。

definition: (onom.) breaking or snapping/(coll.) cut it out/stop it/also written 喀嚓[ka1 cha1]
to sting or bite (of mosquito, bee etc)/to say repeatedly/to urge insistently/to ask repeatedly/to stick to a point/(onom.) tinkling or jingling sound
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
